list-item.p: Stage 1 usually occurs within the first week after development of the adenoviral conjunctivitis, with symptoms of worsening discomfort, photophobia and lacrimation. This is due to diffuse superficial epithelial punctate keratitis caused directly by the live virus.
Stage 2 is characterised by larger, fluorescein-staining white punctate epithelial lesions, and follows soon after Stage 1.
Stage 3 occurs after a further 24-48 hours with areas of combined epithelial and subepithelial lesions.
